channel.title: I cant log on to my server ... [FIXED]!
channel.description:
Ok so let me put it very basic ...
I wanted to create a rs private server but everytime i do something gets in the way i thought i almost had it today but turns out fings are just getting impossible let....
ok here is the run server .... it says im online
[img]http://i42.tinypic.com/kcikgp.jpg[/img]
and then i put my cilent up and type in my username and pass i want but i cant log on...
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/o2ya0.jpg[/img]
i bet your saying well you must have done something wrong with portfowarding or setting up the server ... nope i have done everything needed for people or myself to join the server ....
here is a egue pic thing: [img]http://i43.tinypic.com/2s01ms6.jpg[/img]
im just asking if their is anything i might not have done .. do i need to type in a different ip for my cilent cus my ip is rs300.no-ip.biz and port is 43594 . i have no-ip :D
like do i keep the 217.50232.23.322 whatever thing.......
EDIT::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
FOUND OUT THAT MY CILENT WAS NOT WORKING AND YOU DONT USE YOUR OWN NO-IP YOU USE YOUR STATIC FOR SERVERS COMPUTER !!!!!!!!!
NO NEED TO THANK ME JUST GIVE ME DAM REP :d

item.title: I cant log on to my server ... [FIXED]!
item.dc:creator: @k0ed_u k0ed u
item.description:
@k0ed_u wrote:

well, for some reason, a few people from silabsoft have had this same problem, including me, at first the servers work just fine, then no one can log into their own server, it must be a problem with portforwarding

Read full topic

item.title: I cant log on to my server ... [FIXED]!

item.description:
@Kaligrok wrote:

Change the I.P to 0.0.0.0

Connect with localhost, unless you’re in a LAN.

item.dc:creator: @str_rockstar str rockstar
item.description:
@str_rockstar wrote:

try restarting ur router if u havent yet, and no… dont just pull the plug and plug it back in, go into your default gateway and click restart

item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

also look in your client end search for

0.0.0

you will see things like : 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.0 change all those to your ip
